title: Strictly's Dianne Buswell and Dev Griffin bounce back from horror fall
text:
Strictly Come Dancing’s Dianne Buswell and Dev Griffin have smashed it out of the park after their horror fall as they earned a standing ovation.

The pair, who had a ‘week of ups and downs’ according to the radio DJ, peformed an incredible Couples’ Choice routine to Friend Like Me from Aladdin.

Earning a 36 (a nine from each judge), the pair looked thrilled before confirming to Claudia Winkleman that they’re both fine.

Dianne was rushed to hopsital after suffering a fall during rehearsals for Movie Week.

It was reported that Dev accidentally lost his grip of the Aussie dancer during a lift, with Dianne falling on her head.

Speaking to The Sun, a source said: ‘Dev let her slip from his grasp and Dianne fell and landed on her head. It couldn’t have been worse.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It was horrible to watch Dianne lying prostrate on the floor.’

BBC staff were believed to have rushed to help and sent her to hospital, with Dev by her side who ‘looked in total shock’.

The pair were thrilled with the judges’ comments (Picture: BBC)

However, Dianne was quick to reassure fans that she was okay, insisting it wasn’t Dev’s fault in a sweet message on social media.

Taking to Twitter, she shared: ‘Morning everybody thank you for all the lovely msgs of concern.

‘We had an accident keyword being accident it was not devs fault at all these things happen.

‘But great news is I’m fine and we both can not wait to dance tonight xxxx thanks again for your thoughts and well wishes.’

Dev and Dianne performed the first Couples’ Choice performance of the series, previously dubbing it their ‘favourite dance’.

Strictly Come Dancing returns Sunday at 7.15 on BBC One.

description: Strictly Come Dancing's Dianne Buswell's fall shown on show after Dev Griffin dropped her during rehearsals.
